bhtAttempts.bht: When Jesus pauses in Mark 8:34, he is addressing all who follow him, presenting them with a philosophy of life and death that contrasts with the disciples' and people's understanding. In this moment, Jesus calls for self-denial, an act that is difficult but necessary. He emphasizes the importance of saying no to oneself and taking up the cross, embracing the will of God even in the face of pain and suffering. Ultimately, this is the path to following Jesus in holiness towards glory.
